key_facts: Global temperatures were 1.6°C above pre-industrial levels in March 2024.
Europe experienced its hottest March on record in 2024.
Extreme weather events included droughts and heavy rainfall in March 2024.
Small temperature increases intensify heatwaves and floods.
Central Asia faced an intense heatwave in March 2024.
Argentina experienced extreme rainfall conditions in March 2024.
Climate change exacerbated these extreme weather events.
Arctic sea ice reached its lowest March extent in the satellite record.
The satellite record for Arctic sea ice spans 47 years.
Record lows in Arctic sea ice have continued in recent months.
Data is from the EU’s Copernicus Climate Change Service.
Copernicus compiles data from billions of global measurements.
The 1.5°C climate target is increasingly at risk.
